summary: New Argonian male follower; spell-sword. Comes with own home.
descriptionHtml:
Sazrahn is a darn-skinned male Argonian.

[b][font=Arial][color=#6fa8dc][size=4]Basic stats[/size][/color][/font][/b]:
[color=#9fc5e8]Location: [/color]Sazrahn's Den
[color=#9fc5e8]Fighting style: [/color]Spell-sword. Will use magic and/or a melee weapon. Will raise dead enemies.
[color=#9fc5e8]Level: [/color]Levels with player.
[color=#9fc5e8]Mortality: [/color]Essential (will go down on one knee while fighting if injured; will not die).
[color=#9fc5e8]Disposition: [/color]Neutral.
[color=#9fc5e8]Marriage?: [/color]Yes.
[color=#9fc5e8]Hiring Fee?: [/color]No.

[b][font=Arial][color=#6fa8dc][size=4]More detailed info[/size][/color][/font][/b]:

Saz comes with his own home, a den set underground near Bonestrewn Crest. I tried to make it reflect his not-really-evil-necromancer style, as well as one befitting an Argonian: it's meant to be a little dark and a little damp, with some magical and natural touches. It's fully navmeshed (though I don't consider myself GOOD at navmeshing) with idle markers and furniture, and he comes with an AI pack to use them. I've also added navmesh outside on his little porch area, along with a chair and some idle markers.

Sazrahn's Den comes with a map marker that's visible immediately, so you can fast travel to his house to grab him. Initially, I made the place owned by him, but I ended up making it technically player-owned to avoid complications. It's set as a non-reset zone and all containers are set to non-respawning, so you can store things if you'd like.

The main room has a magical fire, dining area, reading area, alchemy table, training dummies (which give skill XP with [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/32448/?]Dynamic Things[/url]), leaky corner with growing mushrooms, a necromancy area, and an enchanting alcove. A hall leads to the master bedroom, which has a double bed, fire for warmth (Frostfall friendly), table and chairs, nightstand, and storage chests. Off the hall is a mini-room with two extra cots and some crates. The beds are unowned so that anyone can use them; you'll get a rested bonus if you sleep here, but not "well-rested". Saz will attempt to use the main bed to sleep.

Cleaned with TES5EDIT. If the exterior navmesh additions/edits conflict with another mod or you just don't want 'em, you can safely delete those. He might path incorrectly or not follow you toward the door and then magically appear inside, but he won't explode into tiny lizard-man shrapnel.


[b][font=Arial][color=#6fa8dc][size=4]Why does he have his own home?[/size][/color][/font][/b]
I originally had him in Arcadia's Cauldron in Whiterun so that he was easily (and quickly) accessible. However, with so many mods that make towns more lively & add followers to Whiterun, it gets crowded FAST. I also like the idea of followers having a life outside of carrying junk around for the Dragonborn. I use [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/18045/?]My Home Is Your Home[/url] for some of my other followers, but since I made him and could already control his 'home', I decided to make one just for him. I thought it added a bit more to his character to make him feel a little less flat (check around for his notes, journals, etc.).

[font=Arial][color=#6fa8dc][size=4][b]Required Mods:[/b][/size][/color][/font]
None

[font=Arial][color=#6fa8dc][size=4][b]Recommended (but not required!) Mods[/b][/size][/color][/font]:
[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/19283/?]Argonian Raptor Feet[/url] (used in images)
[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/2488/?]Better Males[/url] (used in images)
A follower management mod like UFO, EFF, AFT, etc.

[font=Arial][color=#6fa8dc][size=4][b]A note about screenshots[/b][/size][/color][/font]:

I took a stupid amount of screenshots due to the way lighting affects his skin tone. In dark light, he'll look black; in super bright light, he'll look greenish. I also included my older screenshots of him, crappy as they are, because they accurately show what he looks like with vanilla lighting & (mostly vanilla) textures. Newer screenshots are taken using Real Colors Real Nights (RCRN), High-Res packs, SMIM, etc.

I also took lots of screens with him very scantily clad so that people could better judge what his skin-tone looks like. I don't necessarily recommend running around with a half-naked Argonian wizard, but it gets results.
author: Sunnyemi
